properties.name: shape-inside
properties.computedValue: computed lengths for <basic-shape>, the absolute URL for <url>, otherwise as specified

values.name: auto
values.prose: The shape is computed based on the content box of the element.

values.name: outside-shape
values.prose: The shape is computed based on the shape defined by the shape-outside and shape-margin properties.

values.name: <basic-shape>
values.prose: The shape is computed based on the values of one of inset(), circle(), ellipse() or polygon().

values.name: <url>
values.prose: If the <uri> references an SVG shape element, that element defines the shape. Otherwise, if the <uri> references an image, the shape is extracted and computed based on the alpha channel of the specified image. If the <uri> does not reference an SVG shape element or an image, the effect is as if the value auto had been specified.

values.name: display
values.prose: The shape is computed based on the shape of the display as described in css-round-display.

properties.name: shape-padding
properties.percentages: refer to the inline size of the containing block

values.name: <length-percentage [0,∞]>
values.prose: Sets the padding of the shape to the specified value.

values.name: by
values.prose: <by-to> = by | to

values.name: to
values.prose: <by-to> = by | to

values.name: move
values.prose: <move-command> = move <by-to> <coordinate-pair>

values.name: line
values.prose: <line-command> = line <by-to> <coordinate-pair>

values.name: hline
values.prose: <hv-line-command> = [hline | vline] <by-to> <length-percentage>

values.name: vline
values.prose: <hv-line-command> = [hline | vline] <by-to> <length-percentage>

values.name: curve
values.prose: <curve-command> = curve [[<by-to> <coordinate-pair>] || [using <coordinate-pair>{1,2}]]

values.name: smooth
values.prose: <smooth-command> = smooth [[<by-to> <coordinate-pair>] || [using <coordinate-pair>]?]

values.name: arc
values.prose: <arc-command> = arc [[<by-to> <coordinate-pair>] || [of <length-percentage>{1,2}] || <arc-sweep>? || <arc-size>?|| rotate <angle>? ]

values.name: cw
values.prose: <arc-sweep> can be cw or ccw, indicating that the arc that is traced around the ellipse clockwise or counter-clockwise from the center, respectively, must be chosen. If omitted, this defaults to ccw.

values.name: ccw
values.prose: <arc-sweep> can be cw or ccw, indicating that the arc that is traced around the ellipse clockwise or counter-clockwise from the center, respectively, must be chosen. If omitted, this defaults to ccw.

values.name: large
values.prose: <arc-size> can be large or small, indicating that the larger or smaller, respectively, of the two possible arcs must be chosen. If omitted, this defaults to small.

values.name: small
values.prose: <arc-size> can be large or small, indicating that the larger or smaller, respectively, of the two possible arcs must be chosen. If omitted, this defaults to small.

values.name: <arc-sweep>
values.prose: <arc-sweep> can be cw or ccw, indicating that the arc that is traced around the ellipse clockwise or counter-clockwise from the center, respectively, must be chosen. If omitted, this defaults to ccw.

values.name: <arc-size>
values.prose: <arc-size> can be large or small, indicating that the larger or smaller, respectively, of the two possible arcs must be chosen. If omitted, this defaults to small.

values.name: close
values.prose: Adds a closepath command to the list of path data commands.

values.name: <shape-command>
values.prose: The sequence of <shape-command>s represent further path data commands. Each command’s starting point is the previous command’s ending point.
